text:
My team looks after corporate IT
services, including data center

technologies, so we've been instrumental
in rolling out cloud technologies in our

organization. Our purpose is powering
progress for credit unions and

ultimately improving the financial
well-being of Canadians. We have over three

million members across the country, and
we process over 300 million payment

transactions every month. And we found
that AWS and Central1 are very
like-minded, like, we are very customer-centric, and we want to focus on

innovation. And so, for us, AWS was a
good fit. We just announced our voice

banking - Alexa voice banking - solution.
We're very proud of this, and this is

leveraging some of the great
technologies, like serverless, Lambda, and

Alexa technologies voice recognition, for
people that are visually impaired, for

example. That's probably a very natural
way to do online banking and we really

care about our members and I think this
is something that could work very well

for them. The amount of technology and
innovation that we have this, like, is

something we couldn't run in our own
data centers in the past. We've also had

some great success with serverless,
and our Get Your Share website. Those are

things that we were able to build in a
very cost-efficient way, that we couldn't do

in the past. For us, the primary driver is
being more agile and being faster.

Responding to the customer requests
faster. For example, with our contact

center solution, we recently migrated to
Amazon Connect. And this is a solution

that runs really... it's an order of
magnitude more efficient in terms of cost.
